lines.text: One of our guests is a werewolf, I know it.
All this expense. Why? Protection? Against whom?
I have many enemies. What big man doesn't? In this world, you're either the hunted, or the hunter.
And... You... Are the hunter?
Always.
It's called Agro Art. You cover a canvas in paint, and release your artistic side by beating it with varying kinds of whips.
I'm a landscape man, myself.
I've always loathed parlor games. What am I supposed to do?
[Angrily takes candlestick, which has no negative effect]
There. Satisfied?
Your King is in check
But not mate. The game's hardly begun yet.
I don't have to take that kind of abuse from you.
You just did.
She looks like butter wouldn't melt in her mouth
Maybe... She prefers MEAT
He's been looking for a werewolf all his life, haven't you, Doctor?
But never have I actually caught one.
If this was dinner... I can't wait for the cabaret.

[Holding silver candlestick]
Why don't we pass this around? If one of us does drop dead, we can continue our weekend in peace.
I'm terribly sorry about Tom
There's a man I know on Harley Street. I think Tom should pay him a visit.
You know, if I had my way, we'd be reading about that candlestick in tomorrow's newspaper. "Millionaire hunter done to death by a blunt instrument!"

This film is a detective story - in which you are the detective. The question is not "Who is the murderer?", but "Who is the werewolf?" After all the clues have been shown, you will get a chance to give your answer. Watch for The Werewolf Break.
This is the Werewolf Break. Have you guessed who the werewolf is? Is it Paul Foote? Jan? Davina? Dr. Lundgren? Caroline? You have 30 seconds to give your answer...

[30 seconds later]
Made up your mind? Let's see if you're right.
